segment.source: Deploy Windows 10 using PXE and Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Deploy Windows 10 using PXE and Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: In this topic, you will learn how to deploy Windows 10 using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager deployment packages and task sequences.
segment.target: In this topic, you will learn how to deploy Windows 10 using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager deployment packages and task sequences.

segment.source: Deploy Windows 10 using PXE and Configuration Manager
segment.target: Deploy Windows 10 using PXE and Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: In this topic, you will learn how to deploy Windows 10 using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager deployment packages and task sequences.
segment.target: In this topic, you will learn how to deploy Windows 10 using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager deployment packages and task sequences.

segment.source: This topic will walk you through the process of deploying the Windows 10 Enterprise image to a Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) machine named PC0001.
segment.target: This topic will walk you through the process of deploying the Windows 10 Enterprise image to a Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) machine named PC0001.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two additional machines: DC01 and CM01.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two additional machines: DC01 and CM01.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.

segment.source: DC01, CM01, and PC0001 are all members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: DC01, CM01, and PC0001 are all members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: Start the PC0001 machine.
segment.target: Start the PC0001 machine.

segment.source: At the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE) boot menu, press Enter to allow it to PXE boot.
segment.target: At the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE) boot menu, press Enter to allow it to PXE boot.

segment.source: figure 31
segment.target: figure 31

segment.source: Figure 31.
segment.target: Figure 31.

segment.source: PXE booting PC0001.
segment.target: PXE booting PC0001.

segment.source: On the Welcome to the Task Sequence Wizard page, type in the password Passw0rd!
segment.target: On the Welcome to the Task Sequence Wizard page, type in the password Passw0rd!

segment.source: and click Next.
segment.target: and click Next.

segment.source: On the Select a task sequence to run page, select Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM and click Next.
segment.target: On the Select a task sequence to run page, select Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM and click Next.

segment.source: On the Edit Task Sequence Variables page, double-click the OSDComputerName variable, and in the Value field, type PC0001 and click OK.
segment.target: On the Edit Task Sequence Variables page, double-click the OSDComputerName variable, and in the Value field, type PC0001 and click OK.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: figure 32
segment.target: figure 32

segment.source: Figure 32.
segment.target: Figure 32.

segment.source: Typing in the computer name.
segment.target: Typing in the computer name.
